result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shanna E Deffibaugh

defendant.name: Deffibaugh, Shanna E
defendant.address: 119 N Pearl St  Apt A, Berlin, WI 54923

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:35 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement, defendant will plea to count 1 amended to Misdemeanor Battery and count 2 to Misdemeanor Disorderly Conduct, and will dismiss and read-in 2015CF38.  ADA concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 and 2 as amended.  Court orders 2015CF38 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  

Count 1 & Count 2 
SWD, and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months concurrent to each other

CONDITIONS: (EACH)

Count 1 - 20 days county jail - stayed and to be used at the discretion of the probation agent for disciplinary purposes.
Court costs
AODA & any follow-up
No violent contact with anyone in the defendant's household.
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

Court adjourned at 10:46 a.m.

3:52 p.m.  No appearance by the Defendant.  Atty Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - requests to get reports and will resolve together.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on April 21, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 3:53 p.m.

1:59 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - represents the defendant.  Court adjourns to 3:00 p.m. today.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.

Court adjourned at 2:01 p.m.

2:37 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Court ordersd bond on file be continued.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on March 30, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:39 p.m.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

1:01 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County jail and without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin via telephone.  Statement by ADA - has received a referral for felony bail jumping.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1,000.00 signature bond and condition of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is to return to court on March 9, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:03 p.m.
